channel.title: [PI] Help Please [InsidiX Need help with the IP]
channel.description:
Hey Guys, Well i have portforward, Used Portforward.com programme and its telling me my ports are open, but i have a problem.
I Have been though all the client's files and even used zFilesearch.java to check that i have changed all the IP's (127.0.0.1) to My No-ip.
Then i have compiled it and load up the server and the client and i still cant connect to the server with my no-ip.
It's been a while since i have made a RSPS but if im right,
With PI, Do i connect to my own server with 127.0.0.1 and everyone else connects with the 'No-ip'?
Or should it be possible for [u]me[/u] to connect to the server with the No-Ip as well?

item.title: [PI] Help Please [InsidiX Need help with the IP]
item.dc:creator: @Javatech34 Javatech34
item.description:
@Javatech34 wrote:

No Problem if you have anymore concerns or questions ask me. I’d be glad to help.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help Please [InsidiX Need help with the IP]
item.dc:creator: @Javatech34 Javatech34
item.description:
@Javatech34 wrote:

You have to change the IP to 0.0.0.0 in your client and your NO-IP in your server files if I am correct. You have to have your client set to 0.0.0.0 for you to logon to your own server and other people need it set to the NO-IP

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Help Please [InsidiX Need help with the IP]

@josh124 wrote:

Hey Guys, Well i have portforward, Used Portforward.com programme and its telling me my ports are open, but i have a problem.

I Have been though all the client’s files and even used zFilesearch.java to check that i have changed all the IP’s (127.0.0.1) to My No-ip.

Then i have compiled it and load up the server and the client and i still cant connect to the server with my no-ip.

It’s been a while since i have made a RSPS but if im right,

With PI, Do i connect to my own server with 127.0.0.1 and everyone else connects with the ‘No-ip’?

Or should it be possible for me to connect to the server with the No-Ip as well?
